critique: This executive order establishes a National Advisory Board on Mobilization Policy. It aims to gather expertise from various sectors (business, labor, agriculture) to advise the President on defense mobilization. The order itself doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, or civil liberties. It focuses on economic regulation through mobilization and potentially expands executive power by creating an advisory board. Federalism isn't a primary concern, and social inclusion isn't explicitly mentioned. The board members are to represent the general public.
